achievements: One of the most influential architects of the 20th century
Known for his Prairie School style and organic architecture
Designed iconic buildings like Fallingwater and Guggenheim Museum

occupation: Novelist, short story writer, essayist, social critic
achievements: Considered one of the most important African American writers of the 20th century
Author of seminal works like 'Native Son', 'Black Boy'
Contributed to the Harlem Renaissance movement
Along with his brother Wilbur, credited with inventing and building the world's first successful airplane and making the first controlled, powered and sustained heavier-than-air human flight
